answerText: E. L. Doctorow[10] Francis Phelan kills a scab during a trolley strike in New York in this author's novel Ironweed, the most famous of his "Albany Cycle."
heading: NASAT |2013 | 19 | 15 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: For 10 points each, identify these writers who wrote about the state of New York. [10] The real-life mobsters Otto Berman and Dutch Schultz mentor the title Bronx kid in this author's novel Billy Bathgate. His novel Ragtime is a panoramic of New York City in the early 20th century.
